title.narrative: Somali Integrated Statistics and Economic Planning Capacity Building

description.narrative: The objective of the Somali Integrated Statistics and Economic Planning Capacity Building Project for Somalia is to strengthen the national statistical system in the collection, processing and dissemination of poverty and selected macro-economic data to inform development policy and poverty reduction activities. The Project has four components. 1. Strengthening coordination, statistical infrastructure and data development of the national statistical system component will provide support to the client's key official statistics producing agencies in strengthening the capacity of the country's National statistical system (NSS) to collect data for poverty and macroeconomic monitoring. 1.1. Supporting the Development and Coordination of the NSS subcomponent will support the strengthening of the recipient's legal and organizational framework for the NSS as well as statistical infrastructure. 1.2. Somali Integrated Household Budget Survey subcomponent will support the design and implementation of the Somali Integrated Household Budget Survey (SIHBS) for monitoring welfare, providing macroeconomic baselines and establishing a baseline survey for a frequent data collection system. 1.3. Strengthening Sources of Business and Administrative Data needed for the Compilation of National Accounts and Key Social Statistics subcomponent will address key data gaps needed to produce quality national accounts statistics that meet the basics of the System of National Accounts 2008 (SNA2008) and other international statistical standards. 1.4. Strengthening Human Capacity in Poverty, Consumer Price Index (CPI) and National Accounts Statistics subcomponent will support the training of staff to compile poverty indicators and indexes as well as to draw poverty lines, using new data from the poverty survey and new CPI. 1.5. Development of a Compendium of Statistical Concepts and Definitions, Dat

description.narrative: Total Commitment in Second Quarter of 2020
Total Disbursement in Third Quarter of 2020
Total Disbursement in Third Quarter of 2021

condition.narrative: Section I.A.1(a) of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement:FGS to establish within one (1) months of effectiveness and maintain aProject Steering Committee, chaired by the Permanent Secretary of MoPIED, and comprised of representatives from DNS, MED, NEC, MoFand statistics units of federal-level MDAs benefiting from the Project, vested with powers, functions and competencies, acceptableto the Association, responsible for providing support to the PIU through policy direction and guidance, and facilitatinginter-agencies and federal collaboration.

Section I.A.1(b) of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement:FGS to establish and maintain a Project Implementation Unit (PIU) ledby a Project Coordinator, vested with powers, financial resources, functions and competencies, acceptable to the Association, inorder to carry out the day-to-day implementation of the Project, coordinate activities with all institutional stakeholders andliaise with the Association and other development partners.

Section I.A.1(c) of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement:FGS to establish within one (1) months of effectiveness and maintain ajoint government and development partners forum, chaired by the Director General of DNS and vested with functions and competencies,acceptable to the Association, to ensure consultation, coordination and fluid dialogue between the Recipient and developmentpartners regarding Project activities, planning and budgeting, and review Project implementation performance.

Section I.A.1(d) of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement:FGS to establish within one (1) months of effectiveness and maintain aProject technical committee, chaired by the Director General of the DNS and vested with functions and competencies, acceptable tothe Association, to assist the DNS with the design the questionnaires/forms and survey contents, the analysis and preparation ofsurvey reports, and help with the dissemination of statistical information and monitoring and evaluation results.

Section I.A.3 of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement:Prior to implementing any activities benefiting any MDA in an FMS, FGS toenter into an MoU with the respective MDA establishing the terms of the assistance/support to be provided and the requiredcooperation and coordination responsibilities of the parties.

Sections I.A.2 of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement:FGS to prepare, by no later than September 30, 2020, and then implement,a time-bound, institutional development action plan for the establishment and operationalization of the Somali National Bureau ofStatistics, and the handover of Project implementation responsibilities from MoPIED to SNBS Board, all in a manner and substancesatisfactory to the Association .

title.narrative: Improved national accounts and CPI series
Number of staff (disaggregated by gender) trained as agreed in the integrated training plan.
Number of staff trained on macroeconomic-fiscal analysis, forecasting and reporting (disaggregated by gender)
Number of Annual Budget Outlook Reports and Annual Budget Policy Statements produced by MoF and disseminated.
Number of statistical products supported by the project designed and implemented in line with international standards and availablefor open access
Number of statistical publications funded by the project produced and made publicly available on DNS website (disaggregated by availability of gendered statistics where applicable)
Number of user-producer consultations workshops and feedback reports with relevant feedback integrated in project interventions.
Number of M&E annual progress reports to monitor the implementation of growth and poverty reduction projects and programs outlined in NDP9
Overall user satisfaction score with statistical products and services produced by the DNS as measured from the Somali User Satisfaction Survey.
Number of policy studies produced and disseminated by NEC.
Number of economic policy forums undertaken related to policy studies produced and disseminated by NEC.
Number of UNSD Minimum List gender indicators available using data collected within the past 5 years
Number of survey micro datasets made publicly available online through the National Data Archive (NADA).
Adopted quality assurance framework, including a compendium of standards, concepts and definitions
National M&E Framework for NDP9 developed and implemented
